required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Autonomic Response of Military Pilots of the Air Forces With Chronic Nonspecific Neck Pain in Flight Simulator
clinical_study.official_title: Autonomic Response of Military Pilots of the Air Forces With Chronic Nonspecific Neck Pain in Flight Simulator

brief_summary.textblock: The autonomous response of fighter and attack pilots who attend sessions in a flight simulator will be evaluated by measuring and analyzing heart rate variability (HRV).

detailed_description.textblock: The autonomous response of fighter and attack pilots who attend sessions in a flight simulator will be evaluated by measuring and analyzing heart rate variability (HRV). Eighteen pilot pilots with the status of instructor or student assigned at the time of the assessment to the ALA 23 district of the Talavera la Real Air Base of the Ministry of Defense of the Government of Spain (Badajoz) were studied during a flight simulator session. Subjects were assigned by non-probability randomization to a group of instructors (IG; 7 subjects), and a group of students (AG; 11 subjects). HRV was recorded for 15 minutes at rest and during the simulation of a mission in the flight simulator.

primary_outcome.description: The square root of the average of the sum of the differences squared between normal adjacent heartbeats.
The SS is expressed as the inverse of the diameter SD2 multiplied by 1000, and it is considered to be directly proportional to sympathetic activity at the sinus node.

secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity of the short-term variability in the nonlinear spectrum of the HRV.
Longterm variability in the nonlinear spectrum of the HRV.

arm_group.description: Group of flight instructors at the reactor school.
Group of students at the reactor school.

intervention.description: The HR HRV interval of the heartbeat (variations in the time interval between beats) was used as a measure of autonomous modulation, and the Firstbeat Bodyguard monitor (Firstbeat Technologies, Jyväskylä, Finland) was used to record HRV data for 15 minutes in rest and for one hour in the intervention in the flight simulator. Data was downloaded from the devices to a computer using Firstbeat Uploader software (Firstbeat Technologies), and all R-R interval series were imported into the Kubios software package (University of Eastern Finland, Kuopio, Finland). To calculate the autonomous equilibrium, the commonly used HRV method based on the Poincaré graph was used (Brennan et al., 2001; Mourot et al., 2004).

study_pop.textblock: The selection of the sample was made in the accessible population of the Talavera la Real Air Base (Badajoz).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pilots who had the status of instructor or student assigned at the time of assessment to the ALA 23 district of the Talavera la Real Air Base of the Ministry of Defense of the Government of Spain (Badajoz).
- Present non-specific mechanical neck pain according to the International Classification proposed by the American Physical Therapy Association.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cervical pain that occurs with irradiation to upper limbs and / or radiculopathy.
- Cervical spine surgery with or without the presence of a metallic implant.
- Having received physical therapy treatment six weeks prior to data collection.
- Any uncontrolled neurological or cardiac disorder.
- Being involved in ongoing medical-legal conflicts.
